meanings.definition: To regain or recover (something lost or expended)
meanings.sent1: After losing his wallet, he focused on recouping his money by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: She is recouping the time she lost by studying diligently for her upcoming exams.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was recouping its lost acorns by searching frantically in the park.
meanings.sent4: Recouping his strength after the long hike, he felt rejuvenated and ready for more adventures.
meanings.sent5: The farmer was recouping the nutrients in the soil by planting cover crops to replenish the land.

meanings.definition: To make up for (a loss or deficiency)
meanings.sent1: The company aimed at recouping the financial losses by implementing cost-saving measures.
meanings.sent2: She hoped that her hard work would recoup the trust she had lost with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried recouping the disappearing rabbit by pulling out a stuffed toy instead.
meanings.sent4: His kindness towards others was a way of recouping the love he felt was missing in his life.
meanings.sent5: The team's victory helped recoup their morale after a series of defeats.
